comments.message: It is a bit pricey - here is a recent DIY that could do it for cheap  http://www.instructables.com/id/Make-Your-Own-Never-WetUltra-Ever-Dry-Hydrophobic-/Nissan is working on them for cars http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/181370-nissans-self-cleaning-car-could-kill-off-car-washing-foreverAnd they have fantabulous videos.  Here is a review http://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2013/03/the-internet-demanded-partially-scientific-testing-of-ultraeverdry-in-hd/1/Here is a kickstarter that may have made something that feels good on fabrics. https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/741186545/a-shirt-that-cleans-itself

I also wanted to link to this post https://openideo.com/challenge/fighting-ebola/ideas/already-done as it talks about new Brittish PPE that is being made.  They may be using this technology if you watch their video but the don't say.

summary: Various nanotechnology based coatings can create extremely efficient water repellent surfaces even on porous materials. Coating boots, protective clothing, beds, mattresses, walls,  and other surfaces that might be contaminated by bodily fluids can make even field hospitals a safer environment for everybody.
title: Hydrophobic clothing, buildings, and furniture
